p: Ixodes ticks can transmit bacteria from the genus Borrelia (causing Lyme disease) and Flaviviridae virus (such as tick‐borne encephalitis, TBE). Lyme disease is the most common VBD affecting humans in the temperate Northern Hemisphere. Rainfall, moisture, and temperature affect the life cycle and habitat of Ixodes ticks, and they prefer habitats with at least 85% relative humidity and search for hosts when the temperature exceeds about 7 °C. 147
